title: Intel 286 introduced Feb 2, 1982
summary:
The Intel 80286 (also marketed as the iAPX 286 and often called Intel 286) is a 16-bit microprocessor that was introduced on February 1, 1982 after about three years in development. It was the first 8086-based CPU with separate, non-multiplexed

The post Intel 286 introduced Feb 2, 1982 appeared first on The Silicon Underground.
